alert.note: Alert for Dent (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 7:11AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following county, Dent. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 708 AM CST, The Department of Transportation reported flooding on Highway TT at the Crooked Creek low water crossing in northeastern Dent County from previous heavy rain in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Rivers and creeks are on the rise due to runoff in the warned area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Dry Fork Creek at County Road 2430, Sinking Creek at County Road 568, Gladden Creek at County Road 624, Meramec River at Spur Road and Crooked Creek at Highway TT. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salem, Bunker, Howes, Gladden, Darien, Turtle, Jadwin, Bangert, Stone Hill, Sligo, Howes Mill, Anutt, Lake Spring, Montauk, Lenox, Lecoma, Boss, Montauk State Park and Ozark National Scenic Riverways. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
